author: Mykola Parkhomenko
comment: Well structured To-do and Get Things Done tool. I use it as extention of Toodledo webtool and it works reliability on my smartphone. Best tool if you use toodledo website and need smartphone addon for that.

author: Deborah Smith
comment: This is a great app and I use it all the time but now it's started asking for a license check (which I bought a few years ago) but even though it says my license is valid it won't let me open the app so I can't use it.

author: Gnome Nomad
comment: I like it very much. I keep all kinds of info in it. I really wish there was a way to backup, export and import my full to-do list data without going through Google or Toodledo. Especially since not all the information UTDL contains is kept by those outside services.

author: A Google User
comment: Any chance of allowing for adding photos, maybe in the notes section?

author: Antony Froggett
comment: Good with lots of options, but needs an update to the UI

This has been a wonderful app for syncing with Toodledo for years. Since a few months though it stops syncing and you need to sign in manually again every now and then. However there is no notice when this happens, you can only guess from missing tasks in the widget. Developer says it is due to flaky Internet connection which is strange given all other apps work fine m

author: Dan Magherusan
comment: I paid for this app, taking into account the fact that you say it has the option to share tasks and delegate them:  "Sharing and Collaboration features allow you to assign tasks to others and track status. Use Toodledo’s collaboration features or use the APP'S ABILITY to link to multiple accounts."  After running through all the options, it does not do that, it relies on ToodleDo for this. And on their website that is a PAID premium feature.  Please point me in the direction of the "Share Task" button, if I missed it somehow.   Otherwise, I would like a refund!!! Mentioning unavailable options in a PAID version is not cool...not to mention illegal.

author: Maggie Qi
comment: Do you have the same app in apple store? Need to sync it with my iPad. Would be inconvenient if you do not have

author: Paul Simma
comment: Clickable phone numbers and other commonfeatures found in other modern todo apps are not working.

author: Jeff Rulifson
comment: Works with Android Wear and syncs with Google tasks. Yea!

This is a powerful to-do app with lots of ability to customize. However it's seriously lacking in project management. Would like to be able to have rich text notes under a project to brainstorm it.  Location based reminders are great but it's difficult to make new locations as triggers.  Would like to see integration with Android's new App Shortcut API where long pressing on the ultimate to-do list app icon in Google's launcher would give the option of creating a new task right from the homescreen.  Would also like to see the ability to export specific selected tasks to an email to send to someone else.

author: Dave P
comment: Bad a$$ed app.... I have tried and installed and uninstalled probably a dozen task apps this is by far the most customizable would definitely recommend trying it and purchasing the pro version which is only five bucks great app!!!!!

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Extremely overcomplicated and too expensive! You need to pay for the full version, also for every little plugin and add-on that won't even work. This is a huge waste of time and money too!

author: Lonnie Reeder
comment: Awesome app. Stable and it is a work horse. It just works for me. I love the views and how you can categorize your tasks. And now that they have completed the Tasker integration, makes it more part of my daily life.

author: Jane Burch
comment: Started losing/deleting tasks

author: Luca Pintilie
comment: Best in it's kind
Good program except that you have to pay an extra $2.99 or the app will re-sort your lists automatically.  I really hate sneak thieves.

author: MT Mimulus
comment: A few small glitches but 5 stars for integrating seamlessly with my Blackberry and android tablets and my computer.  It all makes life easier!

Could be the best of its kind thanks to its unique ability to truly sort tasks manually, but a basic feature is missing: the option to export contents to a text file, which forces users to sync on the cloud in case of migration.

author: Randy Johnston
comment: I sync with Toodledo. This app does  everything I want it to. I like that the user can choose among 4 levels of task options. Take time to explore it. It can most likely do what you want.
title: Appropriately named

author: A Google User
comment: Now toodledo android has some of the common sense features I requested for this app. Toodledo app will add a new task and inherit the properties of its view. Common sense or not?
title: Used to be the best todo app

author: David Yeo
comment: Can you please increase the offline cache size; I have 5000 tasks & it takes 5 secs to refresh.  Thanks

author: thomas felmley
comment: use this with Toodledo.  rarely any problems
title: works well, syncs well

author: Leslie Aggrey
comment: Work on the user interface, it really boring add some nicer themes as it is now it's too raw

author: Eric Strom
comment: This is the best to do list app there is. The gold standard.
title: The best there is

author: Eunice Wegener
comment: You have to pay for the android wear app.  Wish that was told in the description so I don't waste my time
title: Not enough info in description

author: Steve Wilson
comment: Only 5 bucks, but I just wanted a SIMPLE app.  I have to go through a bunch of steps to do anything.  It's easier to just use free memo.

author: AmritaSai Elango
comment: This app is wonderful but it would be good if you could set the tasks with TIME. But good app. Nice work:-)
title: Great app.

author: A Google User
comment: Please add voice reminders, voice notes And voice to do list! Best Regards...

author: bow girl Price
comment: It is stupid

author: Mark Davies
comment: A good task manager. I have tried many and integrate with Toodledo.  However, I wish that it were possible for users to be able to configure the order of task attributes/fields in the task editor so that user can put their most used attributes at the top of the list so can speed up data entry/changes...  Love the nagging task reminders feature. Although, wish it were possible to configure so that all new tasks default to having this feature, for tasks created both within UTDL and from the 3rd party Toodledo website.

author: Tracey Wood
comment: Can anyone tell me how I can get notifications on my Samsung Gear 2? They've never worked on it despite me trying many things, all with no luck.
title: Great App on the phone but....

author: Jeremy Taylor
comment: I can't praise the functionality of this app enough. It's the first app I install when I get a new phone. I use it to sync with Toodledo and prefer using to the Toodledo website as it's even more flexible
title: The best app I own by far

comment: The app states no ads when bought but continues to show irrelevant junk. The only valid description of this is theft.   The developer states in his/her reply that ads will disappear when licence is purchased. The point of the above comment is that they did not do so... no comment was made until after the app had been installed, updated, licence purchased, and checked.

reply.author: Custom Solutions
reply.content: The ads will disappear if a license is purchased.

title: Theft

author: Jeff Worley
comment: Tons of features, reliable notifications and a flexible sorting system make this one of the best programs of it's kind. The only complaint I have so far is that the user interface is a bit behind the times compared to many of the newer, Material Design focused programs in this category. I really appreciate the option to display the to-do's in the calendar or not, and the option to set nagging alarms until the task is done is wonderful. Keep up the good work.

author: David Murphy
comment: Long time user. Imminently usable, configurable, logical, and flexible. UI update is fabulous on both phone and tablet. This is the ONLY app I no longer shop around for something better.           UPDATE 10/16. New phone and an install problem. I contacted support. They responded in less than an hour with the right answer. Great product. Great support.
title: Double 5 star

author: Greg Morgan
comment: This version (3.2) takes away functionality that I prefer from previous version, for example the ability to long press a task and quickly change the due date. Please add short cuts from previous version back. Update: split screen view is interesting, raising my review.

reply.author: Custom Solutions
reply.content: All of the long press commands from version 2.x are still there, but are accessed differently. After long-pressing on a task, you will see the various options as buttons at the top or bottom of the screen. Note that you will need to press the menu (3 dots) button to access some commands. This approach is similar to what is done in many other apps.

title: How do I roll back to previous version?

author: Sean xpro
comment: Every time i open the app it says my trial has expired and wants me to check for licence, then it says licence accepted and unlocks. Next time i open the app same thing. I've paid for my licence the app should work without mucking around everytine i open it.
title: Constantly changes to trial app

author: David Slone
comment: Totally supplanted my old approach of bring completely (ToodedDo focused).  Found UTL and went to heaven. I use the native Wear "note to self" interface to create to do items which appear in UTL. I use Alexa and IFTTL to create adds to shopping list and tasks, and the forward them to ToodleDo which auto synchs to UTL. All items end up in ToodleDo and UTL so I can inspect via UTL on phone or Wear, on PC via browser (ToodleDo). Voile'.

author: Shawn Judd
comment: This looks good but for some reason not as easy as I thought I am not able to get any task to show up in the task to do widget.  Which for me, defeats to purpose.  You make task they should show up on the list! Right
title: Save your self time don't dowload
